cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 220 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest tonight, then north-northwest Monday, emerging into the southeast Gulf and tracking northward toward the west-central Florida Gulf Coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward through the Big Bend is within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (possible 3–5+ ft in Tampa Bay area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely Tuesday night with potential for hurricane-force gusts Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 3–5 ft above ground possible in and near Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, if the current forecast track verifies
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches with locally higher amounts could produce urban and flash flooding at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents will hamper vessel movements; possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands
